pageContext.claim: “You look at what's happened in New York now in a short period of time. I love New York, and you look at what they've done, the Democrats and what they've done, to destroy it. They have some categories of crime up 160 percent. One was up 300 percent.”
pageContext.analysis: Shootings incidents skyrocketed across New York City, but Trump is still cherry-picking data to exaggerate this point. The New York Police Department reported a 358 percent jump in shootings for a single week in June over the same period in 2019 — not the entire year. As of late August, murders in New York increased 35 percent over the same period in 2019; shooting incidents spiked 87 — not 358 — percent. The 205 June shootings marked the highest number since 1996, according to the department. Moreover, these increases came as violent crime overall was fell 2 percent.
